channel.title: What are the numbers of the Skills?
channel.description:
Wellllll, i need to know the numbers of the skills for 562's. Like... for 317's its:
[skill1] [skill2] [skill3] Ect ect.
I need to know, like.. what skill1 is.. skill2.. ect ect. I think Skill1 is Hitpoints, right? O-O?

item.title: What are the numbers of the Skills?

item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

Google beats me out every time.

Read full topic

item.title: What are the numbers of the Skills?
item.dc:creator: @bily123 bily123
item.description:
@bily123 wrote:

* [ -1 ] - Combat * [ 0 ] - Overall * [ 1 ] - Attack * [ 2 ] - Defence * [ 3 ] - Strength * [ 4 ] - Constitution * [ 5 ] - Ranged * [ 6 ] - Prayer * [ 7 ] - Magic * [ 8 ] - Cooking * [ 9 ] - Woodcutting * [ 10 ] - Fletching * [ 11 ] - Fishing * [ 12 ] - Firemaking * [ 13 ] - Crafting * [ 14 ] - Smithing * [ 15 ] - Mining * [ 16 ] - Herblore * [ 17 ] - Agility * [ 18 ] - Thieving * [ 19 ] - Slayer * [ 20 ] - Farming * [ 21 ] - Runecrafting * [ 22 ] - Hunter * [ 23 ] - Construction * [ 24 ] - Summoning * [ 25 ] - Dungeoneering

There has been an amazing invention. It’s called google. Found this on the first site that showed up.

Read full topic
item.source: What are the numbers of the Skills?

item.title: What are the numbers of the Skills?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

Well if you want to find out every skill ID, just add a whole bunch of commands (one for each skill) that make a given skill become 99. So, for instance, you can name the commands “skillXX”, where XX is the number of the given skill. While running your client, just type in each command one at at time, and if “skill18” makes, let’s say, herblore, become 99, then 18 must be herblore’s skill number.

This is probably the easiest way, as it shouldn’t take too long to implement.

Read full topic
item.source: What are the numbers of the Skills?

item.title: What are the numbers of the Skills?
item.dc:creator: @bluescapepkz bluescapepkz
item.description:
@bluescapepkz wrote:

skill 0 is attack
skill 1 is defence
skill 2 is strength
skill 3 is hitpoints.
Skill 4 is either range/mage
skill 5 is pray

(Sorry don’t remember much of it.)

Read full topic
